intro: Fissistigma beccarii, commonly known as the Bornean starwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Fissistigma beccarii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting biodiversity and contributing to forest structure.
